author: EnergyBlast_Productions
title: A Great Spinner But a Bit Overpriced
review:
2019 introduced 6 different unique Spinjitzu spinner sets, and Zane's has stood out to me as one of the best.  Mostly the colors of his spinner really drew me into this, but the $10 price nearly held me back from getting this.

The Minifigure

The Zane minifigure included in this set is the same one found in the following Ninjago Legacy sets: Kai's Blade Cycle and Zane's Snowmobile and Monastery of Spinjitzu.  He has some great torso and leg printing, and his new hood piece is awesome.  His weapon is a single silver katana, which is the same weapon every minifigure has in these Spinner sets unfortunately.  

The Spinner

The new spinners comprise of two pieces: the large, dual-molded tornado piece, and the round circular piece on the bottom that allows it to spin.  Zane's spinner is molded in a really nice translucent icy blue and flat white, giving off an awesome ice look.  You can easily put Zane inside the spinner by attaching his feet to two studs inside, and he fits in there very snug.  The easiest and most effective way to spin it is by holding onto Zane's head and spinning it that way. It actually spins a lot better than I was expecting, and does much better on its own without the add-ons.  It's a really awesome representation of Spinjitzu in LEGO form, and I love it.

Attack Add-on

Zane's attack add-on comprises of four identacle aeroblade-type weapons that jut out from each side of the spinner.  Each add-on also has a circular crown that you can attach the add-ons to when you're not using them, and they can also hold the spinner up on display.  Each aeroblade also has a circular tile with Zane's symbol printed on, identical to the ones included in sets such as Street Race of Snake Jaguar.  This is by far the worst add-on to use while spinning, because it seemingly makes it far too heavy on the sides to maintain a lasting spin.

Speed Add-on

Zane's speed add-on is the simplest of the three, but works decently well.  Four white spikes attached by clips onto the spinner, and it helps it spin faster, I guess.  It looks cool, and isn't nearly as difficult as the attack add-on.

Defense Add-on

Zane's defense add-on is by far my favorite.  Not only does it spin the best out of the three, but it looks great with the spinner.  It's basically four identical ice shards attached to the spinner, all in that great translucent icy blue.  

The Price

As great as this spinner is, the price is a bit disappointing.  For $10, you do get over 100 parts, but they're all mostly small pieces except for the spinner, which is still pretty small in comparison to previous spinners like the Airjitzu flyers and Spinjitzu Masters.  Honestly, if LEGO had made these $5-$8 instead, I feel like I would be more keen to pick more of these up right away.

Final Thoughts

Spinjitzu Zane is a great spinner set, if not the best out of the four single spinner sets, but as I mentioned the price could easily turn some people away.  This set has some great parts, a fantastic figure, but honestly if you're planning on getting some of the other sets with Zane and you wanna save your $10, I'd say save it, at least until these fall on clearance or something.
